page.title: 12Environmental Problems
page.content: For nearly l50 years an extensive area between Barrington and Bedlington Station has been a local landmark and an eyesore. During the past two years, heavy earthmoving equipment has been working almost continuously in an effort to remove the offending PIT HEAP. Today we have a pleasant landscape hill in place of the dirty dusty foul smelling pit heap which dominated the town & we have an area of beauty which will give much pleasure to future generations. This is one good example of how todays planners are removing some of the dereliction left behind by the Industrial Revolution and gradually returning Bedlingtonshire to something of its former rural beauty. The Traffic Problem on the Front St continues, despite ample parking facilities behind the street.
